definition[0]: if you rattle something, or if it rattles, it shakes and makes a quick series of short sounds
example[0]: Dan banged on her door and rattled the handle.
example[1]: The window rattled in the wind.
example[2]: Bottles rattled as he stacked the beer crates.
definition[1]: if a vehicle rattles somewhere, it travels there while making a rattling sound
example[3]: The cart rattled along the stony road.
example[4]: An old blue van rattled into view.
definition[2]: to make someone lose confidence or become nervous
example[5]: His mocking smile rattled her more than his anger.
example[6]: It was hard not to get rattled when the work piled up.
example[7]: His confidence was rattled by the accident.
definition[3]: a short repeated sound, made when something shakes
example[8]: They listened anxiously to every rattle and creak in the house.
example[10]: the faint rattle of distant gunfire
definition[4]: a babyâ€™s toy that makes a noise when it is shaken
definition[5]: an object that people shake to make a loud noise and show excitement or encouragement, for example at ceremonies or sports games
